result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary A. Jones

records.addlTxt:
1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Drew Lehman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gary A. Jones not in court. Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Gary A. Jones. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF227/22CF392. Victim rights compliance.  DE was unable to appear as this hearing was originally scheduled for tomorrow at 1:30 pm. Both parties are ready to proceed to trial and Ludwig hearing to be held on Monday morning. Cases will not be joined and case 22CF227 will proceed to trial first.
Demand for Discovery

01:52 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Gary A. Jones, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF227/22CF392. Victim rights compliance. Attorney Rose is requesting an adjournment of the jury trial as the DE is scheduled for surgery. Court will grant request as this is Attorney Rose's first request to adjourn.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 17, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Court is no longer available the morning of 7/13/22 and Atty Rose is not available in the afternoon.  PTC adj. to 8/17/22 at 1:40 PM.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22
Jury selection on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Order

Dates given at Intake Court are incorrect for the assigned ADA (should be ADA Lehman).  Clerk left FPT as previously scheduled, but rescheduled the JS date to 9/26/22.  Confirming email sent to attys.  NOTE - defense counsel not available the week of 8/15.
Br 3 notified of scheduling order

Defendant, Gary A Jones, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:10 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued as previously set.  DE attempting to retain private case set for prelim.  ts

records.addlTxt: Petition for Appointment 0f Attorney paperwork put in criminal clerk bin
Status conference on April 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant Gary A Jones in court.   Clerk: PT
  DE is not eligible for a public defender and advocate counsel paperwork has been provided.  DE waives time limits and time limits are tolled for cause.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Patricia M. and Dukes County Saloon 2324 - 18th Street.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Patricia M. residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.
